story.storykicker: Ruby Rai the supposed topper of BSEB class 12 boards Arts stream did not appear for the board held re-examination on Friday, June 03, 2016.
story.storybody:
In response to the Aaj Tak expose of Bihar Board class 12 toppers Ruby Rai (Arts) and Saurabh (science) level of knowledge about the subjects they had supposedly topped, the Bihar Board had ordered for a re-examination of 14 toppers.

The re-examination was scheduled to be held on Friday, June 3, 2016. The top seven rank holders from each stream were asked to undertake the test and appear for the interview. To retain their position in the merit list the toppers are expected to score above 70 per cent in the written exam.

What was asked in Friday's test?

The toppers had to answer a set of 25 questions from all the subjects for which they had appeared written in the Boards.

While all the remaining 13 students took the exam, Ruby Rai who called political science 'prodigal science' was absent.

(Read: Stunned by video, Bihar Board orders probe into the result of Class 12 toppers)

Reason given for her absence

According to officials of Vishun Roy College in Bhagwanpur of Vaishali, where she studied, Ruby did not appear for the re test as she was �??depressed�??.

It is not clear if Board will give her another chance to take the re-exam.

Why is her educational institute under radar?

Apparently the science topper Saurabh and two other students, whose name appears in the merit list of top 14 are from the same college.

Previously also the college has been known for the high number of rank holders it produces every year.

It is alleged that the director of the educational institute has close relations with some leaders of the Grand Alliance and with the help of some members of the Bihar Board; he has been running this whole racquet for some time now, due to which the college has high number of merit holding students.

How will the final result be declared?

An expert committee of 15 teachers from both Patna and Magadh universities will take a final call on the merit list.

Read: Pass percentage drops, more students score above 90 per cent: Maharashtra HSC
